title: At what moment are you dead? - Randall Hayes

multiple-choice.question: What is the ancient theory that claimed living things were unique because they were filled with a special substance or energy that was the essence of life?
Who advanced the notion that the human body was essentially no different from any other machine, brought to life by a divinely created soul located in the brain's pineal gland?
What is the energy-carrying molecule that cells use for various functions, including repair, growth, and reproduction?
What is the universal phenomenon that means molecules tend to diffuse randomly, moving from areas of high concentration to low concentration, or even breaking apart into smaller molecules and atoms?
What is the reason organisms can't be simply sparked back to life once they've already died?

options.label: C
options.text: Breaking down of cellular arrangements due to entropy

multiple-choice.question: What is the diagnosis that describes potentially reversible conditions, under which people would have previously been considered dead?
What is the process of freezing dying people and reviving them later when newer technology is able to help them?
What is the state of incredibly complex, self-perpetuating organization that characterizes life?
What is the point at which someone is completely dead, according to the text?

options.label: B
options.text: A matter of how much entropy we're currently capable of reversing

options.label: C
options.text: A function of the amount of oxygen in the body

options.label: D
options.text: A function of the amount of glucose in the body

multiple-choice.question: What is the swarm of tiny robots that could potentially be used to reverse the effects of death by moving all the molecules back to their proper positions and injecting all of the cells with ATP?

title: How to create cleaner coal - Emma Bryce

multiple-choice.question: What is the primary source of energy responsible for 44% of global carbon dioxide emissions?

options.label: B
options.text: To reduce coal's negative impacts on the environment

options.label: B
options.text: To reduce coal's negative impacts on the environment

options.label: C
options.text: To restrict the amount of carbon dioxide emitted

multiple-choice.question: What is the ultimate goal of reducing coal's dark side?

options.label: B
options.text: To reduce coal's negative impacts on the environment

title: Could we stop an asteroid?

options.label: C

options.label: D
options.text: A shooting star is a collision between an asteroid and Earth's surface, while an asteroid impact is a meteor that burns up in the atmosphere.

options.label: C

options.label: C

options.label: C
options.text: It is less expensive than using a single laser spacecraft.

options.label: D
options.text: It is more accurate than using a single laser spacecraft.

options.label: C

multiple-choice.question: What is the risk of asteroid impact?

options.label: C

options.label: D
options.text: It is a minor threat to Earth.

options.label: B

options.label: C

title: How does cancer spread through the body? - Ivan Seah Yu Jun

multiple-choice.question: What is the process of cancer spreading across the body called?
What is the first step in the process of metastasis?
What is the lymphatic system's role in metastasis?

options.label: B
options.text: To transport cancer cells to other parts of the body

multiple-choice.question: What is the seed and soil theory of metastasis?

options.label: A
options.text: The theory that cancer cells die easily in the wrong microenvironment

options.label: B
options.text: The theory that the site of metastasis is determined by the location of the vascular and lymphatic channels

options.label: C
options.text: The theory that cancer cells are attracted to certain organs

options.label: D
options.text: The theory that cancer cells are repelled by certain organs

options.label: B

options.label: D

options.label: B
options.text: A treatment that uses radiation to destroy cancer cells

options.label: B

options.label: C

options.label: D

options.label: A
options.text: That both theories are mutually exclusive

options.label: B
options.text: That both theories contain valuable truths

options.label: D
options.text: That one theory is correct and the other is incorrect

options.text: A war against the immune system

options.label: B
options.text: A war against the cancer cells

options.label: C

options.label: D
